componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Smedes Rose from Citigroup.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: You mentioned that some of the acquisitions made in '15 can drive an additional $0.10 when they get up to your company-wide portfolio metrics. What -- can you talk about maybe some of the dilution, I guess, that's embedded in your guidance for this year f
componenttext: You mentioned that some of the acquisitions made in '15 can drive an additional $0.10 when they get up to your company-wide portfolio metrics. What -- can you talk about maybe some of the dilution, I guess, that's embedded in your guidance for this year from the 14-or-so CofO properties coming online?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. So the dilution is actually primarily from the '15 and '16 acquisitions, and you've got about $0.05 in those properties. So from a growth perspective, you've got $0.05 from CofO and another $0.10 from properties that we purchased considering them to
componenttext: Yes. So the dilution is actually primarily from the '15 and '16 acquisitions, and you've got about $0.05 in those properties. So from a growth perspective, you've got $0.05 from CofO and another $0.10 from properties that we purchased considering them to be value-add opportunities.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then could you just remind us when you were calculating your adjusted FFO, how do you treat the convertible notes [indiscernible].
componenttext: Okay. And then could you just remind us when you were calculating your adjusted FFO, how do you treat the convertible notes [indiscernible].

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: The noncash portion we take out as an adjustment, and then the other adjustment is the transaction cost for acquisitions. So those are really our only 2 adjustments.
componenttext: The noncash portion we take out as an adjustment, and then the other adjustment is the transaction cost for acquisitions. So those are really our only 2 adjustments.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Ki Bin Kim from SunTrust.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Ki Bin Kim from SunTrust.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Could you just give a quick update on where your street rates were this quarter or January, whichever one you prefer, year-over-year? And in terms of tying that into your same-store revenue guidance, it sounds like 600 [ph] basis points comes from rate. I
componenttext: Could you just give a quick update on where your street rates were this quarter or January, whichever one you prefer, year-over-year? And in terms of tying that into your same-store revenue guidance, it sounds like 600 [ph] basis points comes from rate. Is that pretty equivalent to street rate growth? So to get 600 [ph] basis points of revenue growth from rate that equal 6% street rate growth for the next -- for this year?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, a couple of things just of note here. First of all, they're high single digits year-over-year, December versus last December, but, again, that could depend on what you did last December with your rates. So we would caution people always to look at it
componenttext: Yes, a couple of things just of note here. First of all, they're high single digits year-over-year, December versus last December, but, again, that could depend on what you did last December with your rates. So we would caution people always to look at it on average. So we continue to raise rates, but then the other thing that's important is what is our actual achieved rate because everyone doesn't come in and pay street rate. You have some Internet specials, things like that. So you also need to look at what our achieved rate is versus our street rates, but, overall, they continue to grow. And, again, as I mentioned earlier, the majority of our growth this year is going to come from our rate increases.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And I think the high single digit year-over-year increase in street rates in December is -- sounds noticeably better than last December year-over-year. If this holds up as we get into summer leasing season, is it reasonable to expect that year-over-
componenttext: Okay. And I think the high single digit year-over-year increase in street rates in December is -- sounds noticeably better than last December year-over-year. If this holds up as we get into summer leasing season, is it reasonable to expect that year-over-year increase in street rates to be more than the 8%-ish number that you posted last summer?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: You know what, Ki Bin, it all depends on how our busy season transpires. We're walking into our prime season with a record occupancy, and we're going to push rates as hard as we can. It's certainly not out of the realm of possibility, but I think we're pr
componenttext: You know what, Ki Bin, it all depends on how our busy season transpires. We're walking into our prime season with a record occupancy, and we're going to push rates as hard as we can. It's certainly not out of the realm of possibility, but I think we're premature to offer any kind of prognostication as to what's going to happen. Give us another 90 or 100 days, and let us kind of see how things are starting to transpire and I think we can add some color. It's too early.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Jana Galan from Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Jana Galan from Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Can you provide some detail on where the stores you bought year-to-date and the acquisitions you're targeting in '16 are located, whether you're trying to increase scale in the SmartStop markets or just generally for the portfolio wide?
componenttext: Can you provide some detail on where the stores you bought year-to-date and the acquisitions you're targeting in '16 are located, whether you're trying to increase scale in the SmartStop markets or just generally for the portfolio wide?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you they're more in our core markets. We're not necessarily trying to add in some of the one-off markets where SmartStop is. I think that we're buying them wherever we can buy them and make it -- at the best pricing possible.
componenttext: I would tell you they're more in our core markets. We're not necessarily trying to add in some of the one-off markets where SmartStop is. I think that we're buying them wherever we can buy them and make it -- at the best pricing possible.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Jana, it's Spencer. The one thing that I would add to this and I said this many times we're not going to get to 3,000 properties by being in Los Angeles and New York. We're going to have a broad national platform. And as we've talked about some of th
componenttext: Yes, Jana, it's Spencer. The one thing that I would add to this and I said this many times we're not going to get to 3,000 properties by being in Los Angeles and New York. We're going to have a broad national platform. And as we've talked about some of these markets that are experiencing a little softness, we also have markets that are performing at levels that are unprecedented. And a geographically diversified portfolio is best, and I think, a rational strategy of saying, look, we can't predict winners and losers over the long haul. Virtually every market will cycle that I'm aware of. We want to be broadly diversified and geographically dispersed, so that we can capitalize on what this self-storage business has to offer, and that is best-in-class performance amongst any real estate class.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then just kind of your thoughts on funding the acquisitions and any guidance for dispositions this year?
componenttext: And then just kind of your thoughts on funding the acquisitions and any guidance for dispositions this year?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, first of all, the funding of our acquisitions included in our share count and in our equity estimates, we have about $225 million to fund the $600 million in acquisitions. So $225 million of equity or OP unit issuance.
componenttext: Yes, first of all, the funding of our acquisitions included in our share count and in our equity estimates, we have about $225 million to fund the $600 million in acquisitions. So $225 million of equity or OP unit issuance.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: And any dispositions?
componenttext: And any dispositions?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, and then in terms of dispositions, we continue to look at the bottom part of our portfolio. Right now, we're looking at $25 million or less in dispositions that are -- we have a few properties listed right now, but it's a small portion.
componenttext: Well, and then in terms of dispositions, we continue to look at the bottom part of our portfolio. Right now, we're looking at $25 million or less in dispositions that are -- we have a few properties listed right now, but it's a small portion.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Vikram Malhotra from Morgan Stanley.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Vikram Malhotra from Morgan Stanley.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Landon on for Vikram. Just want you touch on Chicago. I know it's been sort of one of the weaker markets this year for you guys and we've heard from some private operators that there's quite a few pockets of supply cropping up there. Is that sort
componenttext: This is Landon on for Vikram. Just want you touch on Chicago. I know it's been sort of one of the weaker markets this year for you guys and we've heard from some private operators that there's quite a few pockets of supply cropping up there. Is that sort of impacting that market? Or on the revenue side, what do you think is driving the weakness?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: There is new supply, Landon, and there are pockets of development around the country. You start to think about parts of Texas, parts of Florida, Chicago, obviously. Yes, there's some development going on, and it's going to have an impact. But overall, if
componenttext: There is new supply, Landon, and there are pockets of development around the country. You start to think about parts of Texas, parts of Florida, Chicago, obviously. Yes, there's some development going on, and it's going to have an impact. But overall, if you look at the entire country, 600 assets, plus or minus, coming online this year is barely keeping up with the population increase of this country in terms of new supply that needs to be added. So back to my earlier comment, being in a bunch of markets with an operating platform that optimizes performance is our strategy. And if one market's up, another one might be down. And Chicago right now is feeling softness, and we're okay with it. It's not what we want, but it's not causing us to have a good night's rest. We're able to just rest well with a portfolio that's producing outstanding results.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So is the weakness there you think it is largely attributable to new supply?
componenttext: So is the weakness there you think it is largely attributable to new supply?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you a portion of it's new supply, a portion of it's the overall health of the economy there. I think that there is new supply and we've seen probably outsized supply growth.
componenttext: I would tell you a portion of it's new supply, a portion of it's the overall health of the economy there. I think that there is new supply and we've seen probably outsized supply growth.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And just more broadly on supply, how quickly do you think that, that supply could ramp over the next few years with fairly quick build times in the industry? How quickly do you think that could ramp to higher unit growth?
componenttext: Okay. And just more broadly on supply, how quickly do you think that, that supply could ramp over the next few years with fairly quick build times in the industry? How quickly do you think that could ramp to higher unit growth?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Landon, it's Spencer again. I'd gone on record saying new supply is not a factor really in 2016. I don't think it's a factor in 2017. Lending is difficult, and the credit requirements to obtain a loan are tightening. Entitlements are still very, very diff
componenttext: Landon, it's Spencer again. I'd gone on record saying new supply is not a factor really in 2016. I don't think it's a factor in 2017. Lending is difficult, and the credit requirements to obtain a loan are tightening. Entitlements are still very, very difficult to get generally around the country. And although there will be new supply, I still maintain it's likely to be muted, and I don't expect a hockey stick for the aforementioned reasons. So I think the operating environment continues to look favorable for next couple of years. And as we progress down the road, we get better clarity, we'll speak to it.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then just one last one on the reinsurance income. How much of the increase year-over-year is going to come from higher penetration at SmartStop? And how do you see the penetration of that portfolio sort of trending over the next few years
componenttext: Okay, great. And then just one last one on the reinsurance income. How much of the increase year-over-year is going to come from higher penetration at SmartStop? And how do you see the penetration of that portfolio sort of trending over the next few years?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you it's going to -- part of it's going to come from the increase in that, but part -- the --  overall, our penetration is mid -- low to mid-70s, and it's going to be tough to push it much more than that. So you are going to continue to add t
componenttext: I would tell you it's going to -- part of it's going to come from the increase in that, but part -- the --  overall, our penetration is mid -- low to mid-70s, and it's going to be tough to push it much more than that. So you are going to continue to add to our tenant insurance income through acquisition and through addition of management properties primarily.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: And just remind me what was SmartStop at when you closed the deal?
componenttext: And just remind me what was SmartStop at when you closed the deal?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think their penetration wasn't that different. I think it was a little bit more in the rate and kind of what they're -- the dollar amounts they were ensuring.
componenttext: I think their penetration wasn't that different. I think it was a little bit more in the rate and kind of what they're -- the dollar amounts they were ensuring.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Jonathan Hughes from Raymond James.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Jonathan Hughes from Raymond James.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Just to touch on Landon's question. I was hoping you kind of give some similar commentary on maybe the same-store revenue growth in your D.C. portfolio. Is that being impacted by new supply at all or maybe weaker job growth?
componenttext: Just to touch on Landon's question. I was hoping you kind of give some similar commentary on maybe the same-store revenue growth in your D.C. portfolio. Is that being impacted by new supply at all or maybe weaker job growth?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: We've not seen outsized growth in new supply in D.C., but I think that probably has to do more with the overall health there. It was also one of the markets that held up better during the downturn than some of the others. So if you look at a 10-year avera
componenttext: We've not seen outsized growth in new supply in D.C., but I think that probably has to do more with the overall health there. It was also one of the markets that held up better during the downturn than some of the others. So if you look at a 10-year average or a 5-year average, I'm not sure it's that different than some of the other markets.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. All right. And then turning to CofO [ph] deals that were added to the pipeline, are most of these projects with developers you've had prior relationships with? Or are they new entrants to the storage development market?
componenttext: Okay. All right. And then turning to CofO [ph] deals that were added to the pipeline, are most of these projects with developers you've had prior relationships with? Or are they new entrants to the storage development market?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: They -- some of them we have had relationships with in the past, and I would say none of them are new entrants to self storage. They're all experienced self-storage developers.
componenttext: They -- some of them we have had relationships with in the past, and I would say none of them are new entrants to self storage. They're all experienced self-storage developers.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then what are the yields on those deals versus stabilized cap rates?
componenttext: Okay. And then what are the yields on those deals versus stabilized cap rates?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So obviously, when you get into a CofO deal, Jonathan, your yield is 0. And so what we do is look at the market, and we'd like to generally see about 150 basis points spread between that new opportunity and what a fully stabilized asset would be trading i
componenttext: So obviously, when you get into a CofO deal, Jonathan, your yield is 0. And so what we do is look at the market, and we'd like to generally see about 150 basis points spread between that new opportunity and what a fully stabilized asset would be trading in that market. So it depends on the market.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then that 150, I mean, has that compressed significantly over the past 6 months? Or is it pretty much stable?
componenttext: Okay. And then that 150, I mean, has that compressed significantly over the past 6 months? Or is it pretty much stable?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's pretty stable over the last 6 months.
componenttext: It's pretty stable over the last 6 months.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Ryan Burke from Green Street Advisors.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Ryan Burke from Green Street Advisors.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Net rents on the properties that you'll roll into the same-store pool this year about 20% below the average for the 2015 same-store pool. Just curious if you expect to fully close that gap, obviously, not in 2016 but over time.
componenttext: Net rents on the properties that you'll roll into the same-store pool this year about 20% below the average for the 2015 same-store pool. Just curious if you expect to fully close that gap, obviously, not in 2016 but over time.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So you're saying the properties that are moving from the non same-store to the same-store in '16, what  will we do -- I think a portion of that is not just that they're priced below but also its a function of what markets they're in. I mean, from our pers
componenttext: So you're saying the properties that are moving from the non same-store to the same-store in '16, what  will we do -- I think a portion of that is not just that they're priced below but also its a function of what markets they're in. I mean, from our perspective, we're looking at more what the lift is, change between the 2 same-store pools. So my earlier comments I mentioned it was going to add 50 basis points. Part of that is coming from the properties that are below market rents in certain markets, but you can't always just look at that, because some of them may be in a different market with a lower per square foot rent.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Acquisition volume has been strong across the sector. It's been very strong for you so far this year. Is there any evidence that the smaller private operators are starting to pick up more willing sellers? And what's your general outlook for portfoli
componenttext: Okay. Acquisition volume has been strong across the sector. It's been very strong for you so far this year. Is there any evidence that the smaller private operators are starting to pick up more willing sellers? And what's your general outlook for portfolios that maybe coming to market?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I think as there has been some cap rate compression over the last few years, Ryan, I think, yes, there are a number of folks out there they're saying, "I don't know that it's going to get any better than it is today. I probably ought to take a look at
componenttext: So I think as there has been some cap rate compression over the last few years, Ryan, I think, yes, there are a number of folks out there they're saying, "I don't know that it's going to get any better than it is today. I probably ought to take a look at selling this single asset or this portfolio." We're obviously out in the market looking at everything that is out there. I can't tell you that there's any next big SmartStop hanging out there in the wings for us to go capture in 2016. What I can tell you is we're going to participate in the open market and do so in a disciplined fashion. And we're also going to be going after all of the off-market stuff, because we've got a wonderful relationship with hundreds of operators who, at this point, may decide or elect to sell, and we'll have to see how the next 10 months play out. So we think open market and off-market, we're off to a good start, and we expect to have a decent year in 2016, but I can't predict another home run hit like SmartStop in 2016 because there isn't anything right now on the table.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would say, George, that for the last 2 years, there's been a fair amount of interest from various would-be participants wanting to get into self storage. I think self storage has proven itself as an excellent investment, and whether it's private equity
componenttext: I would say, George, that for the last 2 years, there's been a fair amount of interest from various would-be participants wanting to get into self storage. I think self storage has proven itself as an excellent investment, and whether it's private equity or institutional investors, there is a lot of demand. There's a lot of inquiry to try and put it into the last 90 days or last 6 months, I think, would not be fair. I will just say that we are frequently getting calls, as I'm sure the other major operators are saying, "Hey, I'd like to participate with you. Can we do something together?" And I don't think that, that's going to change because storage is a really good asset class. So nothing out of the ordinary in the last quarter or 2 quarters. I'd just say there's been a constant level of inquiries and interest expressed over the last couple of years.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: We'll typically stabilize a property mid-6s, but that's not necessarily your forward-looking year [ph] one cap. Sometimes, we'll take some opportunities to buy a property that maybe has lower occupancy or is in the lease-up phase. So I would tell you cap
componenttext: We'll typically stabilize a property mid-6s, but that's not necessarily your forward-looking year [ph] one cap. Sometimes, we'll take some opportunities to buy a property that maybe has lower occupancy or is in the lease-up phase. So I would tell you cap rates are all over, and it's going to be market-by-market. In the secondary markets, you might get something in the 7s. But if you want to buy something in New York City, you're not going to buy in the 6s even.

componenttext: I'm not sure it's changed at all, Todd. If you look at our 2015 acquisitions, obviously, that's heavily weighted towards one large acquisition, and so we view that as an opportunity and so we were willing to take a risk on more of a onetime thing there.

componenttext: Okay. And then just lastly, taxes associated with the REITs TRS, the assumption there is about $17 million for the year, so about $0.13 per share. In the past, there've been various initiatives to drive that back down. Any thoughts about reducing that expense? And assuming that the TRS' tax expense does continue to grow, does it cause you to think differently about how you operate the portfolio or run the business in any way?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you we continue to look for opportunities to save taxes in the TRS. We've done solar, we've looked at making sure that the TRS is paying its fair share in terms of acquisition costs from making sure they reimbursed the REIT for access to thes
componenttext: I would tell you we continue to look for opportunities to save taxes in the TRS. We've done solar, we've looked at making sure that the TRS is paying its fair share in terms of acquisition costs from making sure they reimbursed the REIT for access to these customers. So I would tell you our strategy's going to be continue to be aggressive, but I think there are benefits from having a TRS and having an insurance captive. So we'll continue to look for opportunities and ways to maximize our return.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Spencer, I was just wondering as we're getting sort of deeper into the economic cycle here and you guys are doing more CofO deals, how do you just sort of think about the risk of the lease up on the developments. And are you guys sort of changing your und
componenttext: Spencer, I was just wondering as we're getting sort of deeper into the economic cycle here and you guys are doing more CofO deals, how do you just sort of think about the risk of the lease up on the developments. And are you guys sort of changing your underwriting at all or getting more conservative as you kind of analyze these different projects around the country?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would say, Steve, that as we're thinking about CofO deals philosophically, first of all, we have to recognize that historically or compared to the historical lease-up time, we're running at about 1/2 the time that it takes to fill up a property. Now the
componenttext: I would say, Steve, that as we're thinking about CofO deals philosophically, first of all, we have to recognize that historically or compared to the historical lease-up time, we're running at about 1/2 the time that it takes to fill up a property. Now there are always outliers on that. But for us, whether you're looking at the economic cycle as being steady or even decelerating, what I can tell you is that the life-changing events that cause people to use storage happen in good economies, in bad economies, and we are not underwriting anything differently on lease up in 2016 or even 2017 than what we would say. We're doing better than we have historically done, and the Internet is the game changer that's allowing us to drive more traffic at the proper price point to our properties and we were able to afford. And we're going to continually refine that process, so that we maximize performance, and maximizing performance is fill it up as fast as you can in an economic fashion to optimize revenue.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So not to put words in your mouth, but if you knew a recession was coming, you really wouldn't do much differently?
componenttext: So not to put words in your mouth, but if you knew a recession was coming, you really wouldn't do much differently?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: That is correct. We never actually changed our underwriting to be more aggressive when things were leasing up faster.
componenttext: That is correct. We never actually changed our underwriting to be more aggressive when things were leasing up faster.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Jonathan. Welcome to Extra Space Storage's Fourth Quarter and Year-end 2015 Conference Call.In addition to our press release, we have furnished unaudited supplemental financial information on our website.Please remember that management's pr
componenttext:
Thank you, Jonathan. Welcome to Extra Space Storage's Fourth Quarter and Year-end 2015 Conference Call.
In addition to our press release, we have furnished unaudited supplemental financial information on our website.
Please remember that management's prepared remarks and answers to your questions may contain forward-looking statements as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act.
Actual results could differ materially from those stated or implied by our forward-looking statements due to risks and uncertainties associated with the company's business.
These forward-looking statements are qualified by the cautionary statements contained in the company's latest filings with the SEC, which we encourage our listeners to review.
Forward-looking statements represent management's estimates as of today, Wednesday, February 24, 2016.
The company assumes no obligation to revise or update any forward-looking statements because of changing market conditions or other circumstances after the date of this conference call.
I would now like to turn the call over to Spencer Kirk, Chief Executive Officer.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Hello, everyone. 2015 was a record-breaking year. We executed at a high level and produced outstanding results despite difficult comps.For the fourth quarter, same-store revenue growth was 9.3%, NOI growth was 11.9%, year-end occupancy was 92.9% and FFO
componenttext:
Hello, everyone. 2015 was a record-breaking year. We executed at a high level and produced outstanding results despite difficult comps.
For the fourth quarter, same-store revenue growth was 9.3%, NOI growth was 11.9%, year-end occupancy was 92.9% and FFO as adjusted grew 28%. This marks 21 consecutive quarters of double-digit increases. 
We delivered these exceptional same-store operating results while expanding our physical real estate and digital real estate footprints by 24%. In 2015, we added 259 stores to our platform, and our year-end EXR-branded store count was 1,347. 
For the year, we closed on $1.8 billion in acquisitions. Seller expectations are high, and we expect pricing to remain competitive in 2016. However, we are finding accretive acquisitions, including off-market transactions, and we are off to a solid start in 2016.
I'd now like to turn the time over to Scott.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Spence. Last night, we reported FFO as adjusted of $0.87 per share, meeting the high end of our guidance. Including costs associated with acquisitions and noncash interest, FFO was $0.38 per share for the quarter. This was below our Q4 guidance du
componenttext:
Thanks, Spence. Last night, we reported FFO as adjusted of $0.87 per share, meeting the high end of our guidance. Including costs associated with acquisitions and noncash interest, FFO was $0.38 per share for the quarter. This was below our Q4 guidance due to additional transaction-related costs. 
We paid $16 million in SmartStop transactional cost, $8 million for SmartStop's investment bankers and $8 million in severance expenses. These costs were expensed on our books rather than on SmartStop's. In essence, we paid SmartStop's transactional costs with SmartStop's working capital. These costs were included in our original purchase price estimates and had no effect on the transaction on a net-net basis. 
For the year, FFO as adjusted was $3.13 per share, meeting the high end of our guidance. Including acquisition and noncash interest costs, FFO was $2.58 per share.
Our same-store revenue growth was driven by higher rates to new and existing customers, increased occupancy and lower discounts. Our top-performing markets were California, Colorado and Florida. Our worst-performing markets still grew at 4% to 5%, and our platform continues to maximize results.
We had a busy quarter on the acquisition front, adding 131 stores for $1.4 billion. The majority of these stores were part of the SmartStop acquisition, which are performing in line with our underwriting expectations.
Last night, we provided guidance and annual assumptions for 2016. Our new same-store pool will increase by 61 properties for a total of 564. We expect the change in the same-store pool to positively impact our revenue growth by approximately 50 basis points.
For 2016, our acquisition guidance of $600 million refers only to our same-store -- or only to our wholly-owned same stores -- our wholly-owned stores. The impact of our JV acquisition is captured in our equity and earnings.
Our full year FFO as adjusted is estimated to be $3.65 to $3.73 per share. 2016 FFO guidance is $3.57 to $3.65 per share. This guidance includes $0.05 of dilution from our 2015 and 2016 certificate-of-occupancy acquisitions. Our guidance also includes 2015 acquisitions that, as anticipated, will require time to be brought up to our performance standards. Once they are performing at a portfolio average, they should produce an additional $0.10 per share.
I'll now turn the time back to Spencer for some closing remarks.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Scott. We expect 2016 to look much like 2015. Demand is steady. New supply, while present, is still muted, and our advantage on the Internet continues to grow. However, in 2015, increases in occupancy and reductions in discounts contributed appr
componenttext:
Thanks, Scott. We expect 2016 to look much like 2015. Demand is steady. New supply, while present, is still muted, and our advantage on the Internet continues to grow. 
However, in 2015, increases in occupancy and reductions in discounts contributed approximately 300 basis points to revenue. This year, we expect occupancy gains of approximately 100 basis points and little to no additional benefit from discount reductions.
I congratulate our team on the significant growth and the strong performance in 2015. It has resulted in Extra Space being included in the S&P 500. We are pleased to be recognized as a top-tier REIT and a member of this fine group of companies.
Let's turn the time back to Jeff to start the Q&A session.

componenttext: Thank you, Spencer. [Operator Instructions] With that, we'll turn it over to Jonathan to start our Q&A.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And just a follow-up, then, on Houston. With regard to occupancy there, it actually fell rather sharply. It was higher year-over-year last quarter, but was lower this quarter by 120 basis points. And it's now one of the few markets in the portfolio
componenttext: Okay. And just a follow-up, then, on Houston. With regard to occupancy there, it actually fell rather sharply. It was higher year-over-year last quarter, but was lower this quarter by 120 basis points. And it's now one of the few markets in the portfolio where occupancy is lower. What's your read on Houston? And are you operating in Houston any differently than you operate in any of your other markets?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. So Houston is, overall, Todd, 2% of our total portfolio. This is the beauty of a broadly diversified and geographically dispersed portfolio. And yes, there is softness in Houston, and we have not done anything differently operationally on our interac
componenttext: Yes. So Houston is, overall, Todd, 2% of our total portfolio. This is the beauty of a broadly diversified and geographically dispersed portfolio. And yes, there is softness in Houston, and we have not done anything differently operationally on our interactive marketing efforts or our revenue management specifically to try and address something that is just part of the economic softness in that part of the country. So we're going to continue to do everything we can without being aberrational in our behavior. We've got a platform, we've got a system and we're letting the system run based on the laws of supply and demand.

componenttext: I just have 2 questions on rent growth, and Spencer, I think you mentioned revenue forecast for the year. You're assuming little discount burn off in about 100 basis points of occupancy. Can you share what your rent assumptions are embedded within that revenue forecast?

componenttext: So if you look at our revenue forecast, David, the majority of that is actually going to come from rate. You're going to get about 100 basis points from occupancy, and the rest is all rate. So we think that we'll continue to be able to push rates in the mid- to high single digits, and hopefully, we continue to see strength through the summer months here.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And a follow-up to that question. In assets where you have occupancy in the mid-90s or higher and you have somewhat limited inventory, what's a typical rent strategy in those types of assets? Do you push rent to dislocate tenants to create more inve
componenttext: Okay. And a follow-up to that question. In assets where you have occupancy in the mid-90s or higher and you have somewhat limited inventory, what's a typical rent strategy in those types of assets? Do you push rent to dislocate tenants to create more inventory? How do you guys approach that situation?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: We push rate as hard as we think is prudent for the market and for the data that we have for a particular property and the unit size codes that are in demand. Part of the beauty of our platform is that data is probably our single most valuable asset. And
componenttext: We push rate as hard as we think is prudent for the market and for the data that we have for a particular property and the unit size codes that are in demand. Part of the beauty of our platform is that data is probably our single most valuable asset. And if you look at 800,000-plus units that we have information on, we're going to push rate as hard as we can. Obviously, we don't want to dislodge customers, but where we have existing customer rate increases being benefited by lofty street rates, yes, we can get pretty aggressive, both with new customers walking in the door as well as the existing customer, and our system is going to try to optimize the revenue for any particular size code.

componenttext: So it's actually just a financial partner. It's an institutional partner. So it's one we're excited to do more business with, to do -- have more investment with. componenttextpreview: It's Spencer. If I could just provide a little color on JVs. Number one, JVs help us with the dilution part of the equation on earnings. Number two, it increases our return. And then to answer part 2 of your question, new supply generally throughout the c
componenttext: It's Spencer. If I could just provide a little color on JVs. Number one, JVs help us with the dilution part of the equation on earnings. Number two, it increases our return. And then to answer part 2 of your question, new supply generally throughout the country, I think that's question you're getting at. It's still muted, and my own personal number is total number of properties delivered, new assets in the United States in 2016: 600.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016

componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of George Hoglund from Jefferies.

componenttext: I was wondering if you could just want to comment on the expenses in Chicago that were up pretty significantly.

componenttext: It's property tax reassessments. Illinois is very aggressive on an annual basis, and some of those, we will appeal.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then when you think about the guidance range in terms of what is most likely to push you towards the higher end of the guidance range or could even be the outlier that push you above the range, what factors do you think are most likely?
componenttext: Okay. And then when you think about the guidance range in terms of what is most likely to push you towards the higher end of the guidance range or could even be the outlier that push you above the range, what factors do you think are most likely?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'd give you 2 items. One would be if property taxes come in lower than we're originally budgeting. We're budgeting them close to 6%. I think it was 5.8% for our budgets on same stores this year. And then second, well, if rates hold better than expected t
componenttext: I'd give you 2 items. One would be if property taxes come in lower than we're originally budgeting. We're budgeting them close to 6%. I think it was 5.8% for our budgets on same stores this year. And then second, well, if rates hold better than expected through the summer months.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016

componenttext: Okay. And then, I guess just one more. In terms of -- you talked about occupancy. You'd mentioned it earlier that it was about the same or unchanged. Was that versus the year-end? Or is that on a year-over-year basis?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: You mentioned that some of the acquisitions made in '15 can drive an additional $0.10 when they get up to your company-wide portfolio metrics. What -- can you talk about maybe some of the dilution, I guess, that's embedded in your guidance for this year f
componenttext: You mentioned that some of the acquisitions made in '15 can drive an additional $0.10 when they get up to your company-wide portfolio metrics. What -- can you talk about maybe some of the dilution, I guess, that's embedded in your guidance for this year from the 14-or-so CofO properties coming online?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. So the dilution is actually primarily from the '15 and '16 acquisitions, and you've got about $0.05 in those properties. So from a growth perspective, you've got $0.05 from CofO and another $0.10 from properties that we purchased, considering them to
componenttext: Yes. So the dilution is actually primarily from the '15 and '16 acquisitions, and you've got about $0.05 in those properties. So from a growth perspective, you've got $0.05 from CofO and another $0.10 from properties that we purchased, considering them to be value-add opportunities.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then could you just remind us when you were calculating your adjusted FFO, how do you treat the convertible notes [indiscernible].
componenttext: Okay. And then could you just remind us when you were calculating your adjusted FFO, how do you treat the convertible notes [indiscernible].

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: The noncash portion we take out as an adjustment, and then the other adjustment is the transaction cost for acquisitions. So those are really our only 2 adjustments.
componenttext: The noncash portion we take out as an adjustment, and then the other adjustment is the transaction cost for acquisitions. So those are really our only 2 adjustments.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Ki Bin Kim from SunTrust.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Ki Bin Kim from SunTrust.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Could you just give a quick update on where your street rates were this quarter or January, whichever one you prefer, year-over-year? And in terms of tying that into your same-store revenue guidance, it sounds like 600 basis points comes from rate. Is tha
componenttext: Could you just give a quick update on where your street rates were this quarter or January, whichever one you prefer, year-over-year? And in terms of tying that into your same-store revenue guidance, it sounds like 600 basis points comes from rate. Is that pretty equivalent to street rate growth? So to get 600 basis points of revenue growth from rate that equal 6% street rate growth for the next -- for this year?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, a couple of things just of note here. First of all, they're high single digits year-over-year, December versus last December, but, again, that could depend on what you did last December with your rates. So we would caution people always to look at it
componenttext: Yes, a couple of things just of note here. First of all, they're high single digits year-over-year, December versus last December, but, again, that could depend on what you did last December with your rates. So we would caution people always to look at it on average. So we continue to raise rates, but then the other thing that's important is, what is our actual achieved rate, because everyone doesn't come in and pay street rate. You have some Internet specials, things like that. So you also need to look at what our achieved rate is versus our street rates, but, overall, they continue to grow. And, again, as I mentioned earlier, the majority of our growth this year is going to come from our rate increases.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And I think the high single digit year-over-year increase in street rates in December is -- sounds noticeably better than last December year-over-year. If this holds up as we get into summer leasing season, is it reasonable to expect that year-over-
componenttext: Okay. And I think the high single digit year-over-year increase in street rates in December is -- sounds noticeably better than last December year-over-year. If this holds up as we get into summer leasing season, is it reasonable to expect that year-over-year increase in street rates to be more than the 8%-ish number that you posted last summer?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: You know what, Ki Bin, it all depends on how our busy season transpires. We're walking into our prime season with a record occupancy, and we're going to push rates as hard as we can. It's certainly not out of the realm of possibility, but I think we're pr
componenttext: You know what, Ki Bin, it all depends on how our busy season transpires. We're walking into our prime season with a record occupancy, and we're going to push rates as hard as we can. It's certainly not out of the realm of possibility, but I think we're premature to offer any kind of prognostication as to what's going to happen. Give us another 90 or 100 days, and let us kind of see how things are starting to transpire, and I think we can add some color. It's too early.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Jana Galan from Bank of America Merrill Lynch.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Jana Galan from Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Can you provide some detail on where the stores you bought year-to-date and the acquisitions you're targeting in '16 are located, whether you're trying to increase scale in the SmartStop markets or just generally, for the portfolio wide?
componenttext: Can you provide some detail on where the stores you bought year-to-date and the acquisitions you're targeting in '16 are located, whether you're trying to increase scale in the SmartStop markets or just generally, for the portfolio wide?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you they're more in our core markets. We're not necessarily trying to add in some of the one-off markets where SmartStop is. I think that we're buying them wherever we can buy them and make it -- at the best pricing possible.
componenttext: I would tell you they're more in our core markets. We're not necessarily trying to add in some of the one-off markets where SmartStop is. I think that we're buying them wherever we can buy them and make it -- at the best pricing possible.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Jana, it's Spencer. The one thing that I would add to this -- and I said this many times -- we're not going to get to 3,000 properties by being in Los Angeles and New York. We're going to have a broad national platform. And as we've talked about some
componenttext: Yes, Jana, it's Spencer. The one thing that I would add to this -- and I said this many times -- we're not going to get to 3,000 properties by being in Los Angeles and New York. We're going to have a broad national platform. And as we've talked about some of these markets that are experiencing a little softness, we also have markets that are performing at levels that are unprecedented. And a geographically diversified portfolio is best, and I think, a rational strategy of saying, look, we can't predict winners and losers over the long haul. Virtually every market will cycle that I'm aware of. We want to be broadly diversified and geographically dispersed, so that we can capitalize on what this self-storage business has to offer, and that is best-in-class performance amongst any real estate class.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then just kind of your thoughts on funding the acquisitions and any guidance for dispositions this year?
componenttext: And then just kind of your thoughts on funding the acquisitions and any guidance for dispositions this year?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, first of all, the funding of our acquisitions included in our share count and in our equity estimates, we have about $225 million to fund the $600 million in acquisitions. So $225 million of equity or OP unit issuance.
componenttext: Yes, first of all, the funding of our acquisitions included in our share count and in our equity estimates, we have about $225 million to fund the $600 million in acquisitions. So $225 million of equity or OP unit issuance.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: And any dispositions?
componenttext: And any dispositions?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, and then in terms of dispositions, we continue to look at the bottom part of our portfolio. Right now, we're looking at $25 million or less in dispositions that are -- we have a few properties listed right now, but it's a small portion.
componenttext: Well, and then in terms of dispositions, we continue to look at the bottom part of our portfolio. Right now, we're looking at $25 million or less in dispositions that are -- we have a few properties listed right now, but it's a small portion.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Vikram Malhotra from Morgan Stanley.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Vikram Malhotra from Morgan Stanley.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Landon on for Vikram. Just want you touch on Chicago. I know it's been sort of one of the weaker markets this year for you guys and we've heard from some private operators that there's quite a few pockets of supply cropping up there. Is that sort
componenttext: This is Landon on for Vikram. Just want you touch on Chicago. I know it's been sort of one of the weaker markets this year for you guys and we've heard from some private operators that there's quite a few pockets of supply cropping up there. Is that sort of impacting that market? Or on the revenue side, what do you think is driving the weakness?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: There is new supply, Landon, and there are pockets of development around the country. You start to think about parts of Texas, parts of Florida, Chicago, obviously. Yes, there's some development going on, and it's going to have an impact. But overall, if
componenttext: There is new supply, Landon, and there are pockets of development around the country. You start to think about parts of Texas, parts of Florida, Chicago, obviously. Yes, there's some development going on, and it's going to have an impact. But overall, if you look at the entire country, 600 assets, plus or minus, coming online this year is barely keeping up with the population increase of this country in terms of new supply that needs to be added. So back to my earlier comment, being in a bunch of markets with an operating platform that optimizes performance is our strategy. And if one market's up, another one might be down. And Chicago right now is feeling softness, and we're okay with it. It's not what we want, but it's not causing us to have a good night's rest. We're able to just rest well with a portfolio that's producing outstanding results.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So is the weakness there -- you think it is largely attributable to new supply?
componenttext: So is the weakness there -- you think it is largely attributable to new supply?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you a portion of it's new supply, a portion of it's the overall health of the economy there. I think that there is new supply and we've seen probably outsized supply growth.
componenttext: I would tell you a portion of it's new supply, a portion of it's the overall health of the economy there. I think that there is new supply and we've seen probably outsized supply growth.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And just more broadly on supply, how quickly do you think that, that supply could ramp over the next few years with fairly quick build times in the industry? How quickly do you think that could ramp to higher unit growth?
componenttext: Okay. And just more broadly on supply, how quickly do you think that, that supply could ramp over the next few years with fairly quick build times in the industry? How quickly do you think that could ramp to higher unit growth?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Landon, it's Spencer again. I'd gone on record saying new supply is not a factor really in 2016. I don't think it's a factor in 2017. Lending is difficult, and the credit requirements to obtain a loan are tightening. Entitlements are still very, very diff
componenttext: Landon, it's Spencer again. I'd gone on record saying new supply is not a factor really in 2016. I don't think it's a factor in 2017. Lending is difficult, and the credit requirements to obtain a loan are tightening. Entitlements are still very, very difficult to get generally around the country. And although there will be new supply, I still maintain it's likely to be muted, and I don't expect a hockey stick for the aforementioned reasons. So I think the operating environment continues to look favorable for next couple of years. And as we progress down the road, we get better clarity, we'll speak to it.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then just one last one on the reinsurance income. How much of the increase year-over-year is going to come from higher penetration at SmartStop? And how do you see the penetration of that portfolio sort of trending over the next few years
componenttext: Okay, great. And then just one last one on the reinsurance income. How much of the increase year-over-year is going to come from higher penetration at SmartStop? And how do you see the penetration of that portfolio sort of trending over the next few years?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would tell you it's going to -- part of it's going to come from the increase in that, but part -- the --  overall, our penetration is mid -- low to mid-70s, and it's going to be tough to push it much more than that. So you are going to continue to add t
componenttext: I would tell you it's going to -- part of it's going to come from the increase in that, but part -- the --  overall, our penetration is mid -- low to mid-70s, and it's going to be tough to push it much more than that. So you are going to continue to add to our tenant insurance income through acquisition and through addition of management properties, primarily.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: And just remind me what was SmartStop at when you closed the deal?
componenttext: And just remind me what was SmartStop at when you closed the deal?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think their penetration wasn't that different. I think it was a little bit more in the rate and kind of what they're -- the dollar amounts they were ensuring.
componenttext: I think their penetration wasn't that different. I think it was a little bit more in the rate and kind of what they're -- the dollar amounts they were ensuring.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Jonathan Hughes from Raymond James.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Jonathan Hughes from Raymond James.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Just to touch on Landon's question. I was hoping you kind of give some similar commentary on maybe the same-store revenue growth in your D.C. portfolio. Is that being impacted by new supply at all or maybe weaker job growth?
componenttext: Just to touch on Landon's question. I was hoping you kind of give some similar commentary on maybe the same-store revenue growth in your D.C. portfolio. Is that being impacted by new supply at all or maybe weaker job growth?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: We've not seen outsized growth in new supply in D.C., but I think that probably has to do more with the overall health there. It was also one of the markets that held up better during the downturn than some of the others. So if you look at a 10-year avera
componenttext: We've not seen outsized growth in new supply in D.C., but I think that probably has to do more with the overall health there. It was also one of the markets that held up better during the downturn than some of the others. So if you look at a 10-year average or a 5-year average, I'm not sure it's that different than some of the other markets.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. All right. And then turning to CofO deals that were added to the pipeline, are most of these projects with developers you've had prior relationships with? Or are they new entrants to the storage development market?
componenttext: Okay. All right. And then turning to CofO deals that were added to the pipeline, are most of these projects with developers you've had prior relationships with? Or are they new entrants to the storage development market?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: They -- some of them we have had relationships with in the past, and I would say none of them are new entrants to self storage. They're all experienced self-storage developers.
componenttext: They -- some of them we have had relationships with in the past, and I would say none of them are new entrants to self storage. They're all experienced self-storage developers.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then what are the yields on those deals versus stabilized cap rates?
componenttext: Okay. And then what are the yields on those deals versus stabilized cap rates?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So obviously, when you get into a CofO deal, Jonathan, your yield is 0. And so what we do is look at the market, and we'd like to generally see about 150 basis points spread between that new opportunity and what a fully stabilized asset would be trading i
componenttext: So obviously, when you get into a CofO deal, Jonathan, your yield is 0. And so what we do is look at the market, and we'd like to generally see about 150 basis points spread between that new opportunity and what a fully stabilized asset would be trading in that market. So it depends. Depends on the market.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then that 150, I mean, has that compressed significantly over the past 6 months? Or is it pretty much stable?
componenttext: Okay. And then that 150, I mean, has that compressed significantly over the past 6 months? Or is it pretty much stable?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's pretty stable over the last 6 months.
componenttext: It's pretty stable over the last 6 months.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Ryan Burke from Green Street Advisors.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Ryan Burke from Green Street Advisors.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Net rents on the properties that you'll roll into the same-store pool this year about 20% below the average for the 2015 same-store pool. Just curious if you expect to fully close that gap, obviously, not in 2016, but over time.
componenttext: Net rents on the properties that you'll roll into the same-store pool this year about 20% below the average for the 2015 same-store pool. Just curious if you expect to fully close that gap, obviously, not in 2016, but over time.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So you're saying the properties that are moving from the non same-store to the same-store in '16, what  will we do with that. I think a portion of that is not just that they're priced below but also its a function of what markets they're in. I mean, from
componenttext: So you're saying the properties that are moving from the non same-store to the same-store in '16, what  will we do with that. I think a portion of that is not just that they're priced below but also its a function of what markets they're in. I mean, from our perspective, we're looking at more what the lift is, change between the 2 same-store pools. So, some of my earlier comments, I mentioned it was going to add 50 basis points. Part of that is coming from the properties that are below market rents in certain markets, but you can't always just look at that, because some of them may be in a different market with a lower per square foot rent.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Acquisition volume has been strong across the sector. It's been very strong for you so far this year. Is there any evidence that the smaller private operators are starting to pick up more willing sellers? And what's your general outlook for portfoli
componenttext: Okay. Acquisition volume has been strong across the sector. It's been very strong for you so far this year. Is there any evidence that the smaller private operators are starting to pick up more willing sellers? And what's your general outlook for portfolios that may be coming to market?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I think as there has been some cap rate compression over the last few years, Ryan, I think, yes, there are a number of folks out there they're saying, "I don't know that it's going to get any better than it is today. I probably ought to take a look at
componenttext: So I think as there has been some cap rate compression over the last few years, Ryan, I think, yes, there are a number of folks out there they're saying, "I don't know that it's going to get any better than it is today. I probably ought to take a look at selling this single asset or this portfolio." We're obviously out in the market looking at everything that is out there. I can't tell you that there's any next big SmartStop hanging out there in the wings for us to go capture in 2016. What I can tell you is we're going to participate in the open market and do so in a disciplined fashion. And we're also going to be going after all of the off-market stuff, because we've got a wonderful relationship with hundreds of operators who, at this point, may decide or elect to sell, and we'll have to see how the next 10 months play out. So we think open market and off-market, we're off to a good start, and we expect to have a decent year in 2016, but I can't predict another home run hit like SmartStop in 2016, because there isn't anything right now on the table.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Wes Golladay from RBC Capital Markets.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Wes Golladay from RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: First off, congrats on the S&P 500 add. Looking at SmartStop, what is your forecast for expense growth for that portfolio this year?
componenttext: First off, congrats on the S&P 500 add. Looking at SmartStop, what is your forecast for expense growth for that portfolio this year?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: So in terms expense growth, we actually didn't model it at all in terms of what they had their expenses at versus ours. We actually just model entirely based on what our expense structure is. So we took what our payroll structure is. We took the pro forma
componenttext: So in terms expense growth, we actually didn't model it at all in terms of what they had their expenses at versus ours. We actually just model entirely based on what our expense structure is. So we took what our payroll structure is. We took the pro forma property tax adjustments, all of that. So I couldn't even comment on what the growth would be in expenses.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then looking at the 600 facilities coming online in 2016, how much of that is competitive for your portfolio? And do you see any markets where supply will meaningfully overwhelm demand?
componenttext: Okay. And then looking at the 600 facilities coming online in 2016, how much of that is competitive for your portfolio? And do you see any markets where supply will meaningfully overwhelm demand?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think a portion of those are, obviously, competitive to us. I would tell you that I don't see a single market where it's going to overwhelm demand. I think you are seeing more construction in Texas and in Florida, in Chicago, some of the markets where i
componenttext: I think a portion of those are, obviously, competitive to us. I would tell you that I don't see a single market where it's going to overwhelm demand. I think you are seeing more construction in Texas and in Florida, in Chicago, some of the markets where it's typically and historically a little bit easier to build and get things entitled.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] Our next question is a follow-up from the line of George Hoglund from Jefferies.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] Our next question is a follow-up from the line of George Hoglund from Jefferies.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, just one additional question. On the past, I guess, few months, have you seen any change in appetite from JV partners in terms of how much they want to buy? Or have you seen new JV partners looking to enter into the space?
componenttext: Yes, just one additional question. On the past, I guess, few months, have you seen any change in appetite from JV partners in terms of how much they want to buy? Or have you seen new JV partners looking to enter into the space?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: I would say, George, that for the last 2 years, there's been a fair amount of interest from various would-be participants wanting to get into self storage. I think self storage has proven itself as an excellent investment, and whether it's private equity
componenttext: I would say, George, that for the last 2 years, there's been a fair amount of interest from various would-be participants wanting to get into self storage. I think self storage has proven itself as an excellent investment, and whether it's private equity or institutional investors, there is a lot of demand. There's a lot of inquiry. To try and put it into the last 90 days or last 6 months, I think, would not be fair. I will just say that we are frequently getting calls, as I'm sure the other major operators are saying, "Hey, I'd like to participate with you. Can we do something together?" And I don't think that, that's going to change because storage is a really good asset class. So nothing out of the ordinary in the last quarter or 2 quarters. I'd just say there's been a constant level of inquiries and interest expressed over the last couple of years.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just on cap rates on acquisitions, what are you seeing on stabilized properties for some of the stuff you've been doing year-to-date?
componenttext: Okay. And then just on cap rates on acquisitions, what are you seeing on stabilized properties for some of the stuff you've been doing year-to-date?

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
componenttextpreview: We'll typically stabilize a property mid-6s, but that's not necessarily your forward-looking, year one cap. Sometimes, we'll take some opportunities to buy a property that maybe has lower occupancy or is in the lease-up phase. So I would tell you cap rate
componenttext: We'll typically stabilize a property mid-6s, but that's not necessarily your forward-looking, year one cap. Sometimes, we'll take some opportunities to buy a property that maybe has lower occupancy or is in the lease-up phase. So I would tell you cap rates are all over, and it's going to be market-by-market. In the secondary markets, you might get something in the 7s. But if you want to buy something in New York City, you're not going to buy in the 6s, even.

componenttext: Yes. So in the past, you said that you would tolerate about 3% FFO dilution from CofO and development deals. In 2016, it sounds like you're expecting about $0.15 overall. So $0.05 I think, Scott, you said from CofO deals and $0.10 from development and lease-up deals. So that's a little over 4% at the midpoint of guidance, and you're taking up your exposure to CofO deals. Has your tolerance for FFO dilution changed at all? Or is there anything in terms of risk that you're willing to tolerate more at this point?

componenttextpreview: I'm not sure it's changed at all, Todd. If you look at our 2015 acquisitions, obviously, that's heavily weighted towards one large acquisition, and so we view that as an opportunity and so we were willing to take a risk on more of a onetime thing there.
componenttext: I'm not sure it's changed at all, Todd. If you look at our 2015 acquisitions, obviously, that's heavily weighted towards one large acquisition, and so we view that as an opportunity and so we were willing to take a risk on more of a onetime thing there.

headline: Extra Space Storage Inc., Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 24, 2016
